description: System-generated unique identifier for the warehouse location record; serves as the primary key for joins and references.
Identifier of the warehouse facility that this location belongs to, typically a foreign key to the warehouse master.
Human-readable code or name for the physical storage spot within the warehouse (bin, shelf, room, etc.).
Free-text description of the storage location to aid identification or provide context.
Likely first-level sublocation component within the warehouse (e.g., zone/aisle); confirm with SME.
Likely second-level sublocation component (e.g., rack/row); confirm with SME.
Likely third-level sublocation component (e.g., shelf/slot); confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the storage location is currently available for use in inventory operations.
Optional notes about the location, such as restrictions, hazards, or usage instructions.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this record.
Timestamp when a user last updated this record; name suggests a user reference but stores a date-timeâ€”confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user or process that created the record; confirm source system mapping.
Date and time when the record was initially created.
Identifier of the user or process that last modified the record.
Date and time of the most recent user-driven modification.
